verses.kjv: Send ye the lamb to the ruler of the land from Sela to the wilderness, unto the mount of the daughter of Zion.
verses.ct: Send lambs as tribute to the ruler of the land, from Sela through the desert, to the mountain of the daughter of Zion.

verses.kjv: For it shall be, that, as a wandering bird cast out of the nest, so the daughters of Moab shall be at the fords of Arnon.
verses.ct: The women of Moab will be like fluttering birds pushed from their nest, scattered at the crossing points of the Arnon River.

verses.kjv: Take counsel, execute judgment; make thy shadow as the night in the midst of the noonday; hide the outcasts; bewray not him that wandereth.
verses.ct: Give us your advice and make a fair decision. Provide shade like nighttime in the blazing midday heat. Shelter the refugees and don't expose those who are fleeing.

verses.kjv: Let mine outcasts dwell with thee, Moab; be thou a covert to them from the face of the spoiler: for the extortioner is at an end, the spoiler ceaseth, the oppressors are consumed out of the land.
verses.ct: Let my displaced people stay with you, Moab. Be a hiding place for them from the destroyer. The oppressor will come to an end, the destruction will stop, and those who trample others will be wiped from the land.

verses.kjv: And in mercy shall the throne be established: and he shall sit upon it in truth in the tabernacle of David, judging, and seeking judgment, and hasting righteousness.
verses.ct: Then a throne will be established through mercy, and someone will sit on it faithfully in the house of David — a ruler who pursues justice, seeks what is right, and is quick to act in righteousness.

verses.kjv: We have heard of the pride of Moab; he is very proud: even of his haughtiness, and his pride, and his wrath: but his lies shall not be so.
verses.ct: We have all heard about Moab's pride — how incredibly arrogant he is — his conceit, his pride, and his rage. But his boasting amounts to nothing.

verses.kjv: Therefore shall Moab howl for Moab, every one shall howl: for the foundations of Kirhareseth shall ye mourn; surely they are stricken.
verses.ct: So Moab will wail for Moab; everyone will cry out. You will grieve over the raisin cakes of Kir Hareseth, for they are completely destroyed.

verses.kjv: For the fields of Heshbon languish, and the vine of Sibmah: the lords of the heathen have broken down the principal plants thereof, they are come even unto Jazer, they wandered through the wilderness: her branches are stretched out, they are gone over the sea.
verses.ct: The fields of Heshbon are withering, and so are the grapevines of Sibmah. The rulers of the nations have trampled their finest vines — vines that once reached as far as Jazer and spread into the desert. Their branches stretched out and crossed over the sea.

verses.kjv: Therefore I will bewail with the weeping of Jazer the vine of Sibmah: I will water thee with my tears, O Heshbon, and Elealeh: for the shouting for thy summer fruits and for thy harvest is fallen.
verses.ct: That is why I weep for the vines of Sibmah, just as Jazer weeps. I drench you with my tears, Heshbon and Elealeh, because the joyful shouts over your summer fruit and your harvest have been silenced.

verses.kjv: And gladness is taken away, and joy out of the plentiful field; and in the vineyards there shall be no singing, neither shall there be shouting: the treaders shall tread out no wine in their presses; I have made their vintage shouting to cease.
verses.ct: Celebration and happiness have been stripped from the fertile fields. No one sings in the vineyards anymore, and no one shouts with joy. No one treads grapes in the winepresses. I have put an end to the shouts of the harvest.

verses.kjv: Wherefore my bowels shall sound like an harp for Moab, and mine inward parts for Kirharesh.
verses.ct: That is why my heart cries out like a harp for Moab, and my deepest emotions ache for Kir Haresh.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, when it is seen that Moab is weary on the high place, that he shall come to his sanctuary to pray; but he shall not prevail.
verses.ct: When Moab appears at the hilltop shrine and wears himself out, he will go to his temple to pray — but it will do him no good.

verses.kjv: This is the word that the LORD hath spoken concerning Moab since that time.
verses.ct: This is the message that the LORD spoke about Moab in the past.

verses.kjv: But now the LORD hath spoken, saying, Within three years, as the years of an hireling, and the glory of Moab shall be contemned, with all that great multitude; and the remnant shall be very small and feeble.
verses.ct: But now the LORD has declared: "Within 3 years — counted precisely like a hired worker's contract — Moab's glory will be despised, along with all its vast population. The survivors will be an extremely small and weak remnant."
